pageContext.claim: “Nearly two decades ago, politicians in Washington placed China into the WTO -- the World Trade Organization -- one of the great catastrophes in the history of our country as far as trade is concerned -- between that and NAFTA, you had two real beauties -- allowing it to largely do whatever they want to do to the American marketplace.During that time, we lost nearly one in four manufacturing jobs and racked up trillions and trillions of dollars in trade deficits.”
pageContext.analysis: Most economists would agree that China’s industrial rise caused millions of job losses in the United States and thousands of factory closures. There’s no definitive estimate of how many of these jobs were lost or how many of these factories closed specifically because of China. The research on this question is limited, indicating that China had an outsize impact but that there were other factors at play, such as automation.
